meanings.definition: A tall vertical structure used to support overhead power lines.
meanings.sent1: The pylons stood tall along the road, holding up the power lines.
meanings.sent2: The workers installed new pylons to carry electricity across the city.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the pylon, thinking it was a tree.
meanings.sent4: The pylons stretched into the sky like giants holding up a massive web of wires.
meanings.sent5: In the storm, the pylons glowed with electricity, lighting up the night sky.

meanings.definition: A marker or boundary post, typically used in construction or navigation.
meanings.sent1: The pylon marked the edge of the construction site, warning people to stay back.
meanings.sent2: The sailors relied on the pylons to guide their ship safely through the rocky waters.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the pylon was a magical wand, casting spells in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The pylon in the field stood like a sentinel, guarding the entrance to the forbidden forest.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange color of the pylon made it impossible to miss along the roadside.

meanings.definition: A structure used to support bridges or other elevated structures.
meanings.sent1: The engineers reinforced the pylons to ensure the stability of the bridge.
meanings.sent2: The massive pylons held up the weight of the highway overpass.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons perched on the pylon, enjoying the view from above.
meanings.sent4: The pylon beneath the bridge resembled a giant's hand, lifting the road into the air.
meanings.sent5: The sunset cast a warm glow on the pylons, creating a picturesque scene by the river.
